title: Robert F Kennedy Jr defends Trump Endorsement amidst family backlash: 'They're troubled by my decisions, but ...'
content: Robert F Kennedy Jr defended his endorsement of Donald Trump following backlash from his family. Appearing on Fox News, Kennedy admitted the decision troubled his Democratic-leaning siblings and wife Cheryl Hines. He acknowledged the family's disapproval but stressed the importance of maintaining love and respect despite differing political views.
summary: Robert F Kennedy Jr defended his endorsement of Donald Trump following backlash from his family. Appearing on Fox News, Kennedy admitted the decision troubled his Democratic-leaning siblings and wife Cheryl Hines. He acknowledged the family's disapproval but stressed the importance of maintaining love and respect despite differing political views.

title: Trump’s campaign to target ‘Comrade’ and ‘Border Czar’ Kamala over economy and border security
content: Donald Trump planned to focus his presidential campaign on border security and the economy. He believed Kamala Harris was struggling with these issues. Trump was vocal about Harris on social media, especially after her speech at the Democratic National Convention. A recent poll showed Harris leading Trump by 7 points nationally.
summary: Donald Trump planned to focus his presidential campaign on border security and the economy. He believed Kamala Harris was struggling with these issues. Trump was vocal about Harris on social media, especially after her speech at the Democratic National Convention. A recent poll showed Harris leading Trump by 7 points nationally.

title: Mobile phone services to stay suspended in Pakistan's Karachi
content: The Sindh home department suspended cellular services in Karachi, Hyderabad, and several other districts following a violent incident between religious groups in Golimar. This precautionary measure aimed to ensure safety during Chehlum processions and gatherings honoring Hazrat Imam Hussain (RA). The attack left two dead and nine injured, escalating tensions and prompting a significant police presence.
summary: The Sindh home department suspended cellular services in Karachi, Hyderabad, and several other districts following a violent incident between religious groups in Golimar. This precautionary measure aimed to ensure safety during Chehlum processions and gatherings honoring Hazrat Imam Hussain (RA). The attack left two dead and nine injured, escalating tensions and prompting a significant police presence.

title: Barron Trump heads to college under watchful eye of Secret Service: ‘The goal is to ...’
content: Barron Trump, the youngest child of former President Donald Trump, has begun his college journey in New York under the watchful eye of the Secret Service. Although his exact university remains undisclosed, institutions like NYU and Columbia are speculated.
summary: Barron Trump, the youngest child of former President Donald Trump, has begun his college journey in New York under the watchful eye of the Secret Service. Although his exact university remains undisclosed, institutions like NYU and Columbia are speculated.

title: Who is Larry the cat? Downing Street’s beloved feline, who witnessed tenure of 6 UK PMs, faces his final days
content: Larry the cat, Number 10 Downing Street's 'chief mouser,' is nearing his 17th year, prompting officials to draft 'Operation Larry Bridges' for his eventual farewell. Adopted in 2011, Larry has seen six prime ministers and even had famous spats with other feline residents. The plan aims to announce his passing with due respect and dignity.
summary: Larry the cat, Number 10 Downing Street's 'chief mouser,' is nearing his 17th year, prompting officials to draft 'Operation Larry Bridges' for his eventual farewell. Adopted in 2011, Larry has seen six prime ministers and even had famous spats with other feline residents. The plan aims to announce his passing with due respect and dignity.

title: War in Gaza: Is it time for Israel to break Iran’s 'strangling loop’?
content: Most Israelis supported a ceasefire to retrieve hostages from Gaza but were unhappy with the government, believing Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu prolonged the conflict for personal reasons. Despite this, Netanyahu's popularity improved, with many backing an expanded conflict involving Hezbollah and Iran. The nation remains divided over the war's conduct and potential expansion.
summary: Most Israelis supported a ceasefire to retrieve hostages from Gaza but were unhappy with the government, believing Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu prolonged the conflict for personal reasons. Despite this, Netanyahu's popularity improved, with many backing an expanded conflict involving Hezbollah and Iran. The nation remains divided over the war's conduct and potential expansion.

title: Australia's new 'Right to disconnect' law: What you need to know
content: Australia implemented a 'right to disconnect' law, allowing workers to ignore job-related communications outside regular hours. The regulation aims to protect personal time and promote work-life balance, effective from today. While it generally prohibits work communications after hours, exceptions are made for emergencies. The Fair Work Commission enforces the law, ensuring compliance with penalties for violations.
summary: Australia implemented a 'right to disconnect' law, allowing workers to ignore job-related communications outside regular hours. The regulation aims to protect personal time and promote work-life balance, effective from today. While it generally prohibits work communications after hours, exceptions are made for emergencies. The Fair Work Commission enforces the law, ensuring compliance with penalties for violations.

title: Mid-air refueling to precision strikes: Watch Israeli Air Force target Hezbollah as Netanyahu declares 'this is not the final word'
content: On Sunday, the Israeli Air Force conducted precision strikes against Hezbollah targets in Lebanon, aiming to prevent a significant attack. The operation, involving over 100 warplanes, destroyed Hezbollah's missile launchers and drones. Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu stated that the military action was necessary to safeguard Israeli citizens and is not yet concluded. Hezbollah retaliated, firing over 300 projectiles into Israel.
summary: On Sunday, the Israeli Air Force conducted precision strikes against Hezbollah targets in Lebanon, aiming to prevent a significant attack. The operation, involving over 100 warplanes, destroyed Hezbollah's missile launchers and drones. Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu stated that the military action was necessary to safeguard Israeli citizens and is not yet concluded. Hezbollah retaliated, firing over 300 projectiles into Israel.

title: From Elon Musk to Tucker Carlson: International support pours in for arrested Telegram founder Pavel Durov
content: French-Russian tech tycoon Pavel Durov was detained at a Paris airport over alleged offences linked to his messaging app Telegram, including fraud and drug trafficking. His arrest, pending a court appearance, has stirred discussions about Telegram's content moderation policies, with notable figures expressing concerns over free speech and censorship implications.
summary: French-Russian tech tycoon Pavel Durov was detained at a Paris airport over alleged offences linked to his messaging app Telegram, including fraud and drug trafficking. His arrest, pending a court appearance, has stirred discussions about Telegram's content moderation policies, with notable figures expressing concerns over free speech and censorship implications.

title: Palestinian prisoner, who was used as human shield by Israeli military, dies
content: Zaher Raddad, a 19-year-old Palestinian prisoner, died at an Israeli hospital. He was previously used as a human shield by the Israeli military during a military operation. Arrested on July 23, Raddad hailed from Saida in Tulkarm. Since the October 7 Hamas attack, 23 prisoners have died in Israeli custody. Truce talks are ongoing in Doha.
summary: Zaher Raddad, a 19-year-old Palestinian prisoner, died at an Israeli hospital. He was previously used as a human shield by the Israeli military during a military operation. Arrested on July 23, Raddad hailed from Saida in Tulkarm. Since the October 7 Hamas attack, 23 prisoners have died in Israeli custody. Truce talks are ongoing in Doha.

title: Musk in the White House? Trump floats Elon as US government 'fat cutter' extraordinaire; Watch video
content: Former President Donald Trump expressed interest in having Elon Musk help streamline government operations if he wins the upcoming election. Trump praised Musk's brilliance and suggested he could serve as a high-level consultant focusing on artificial intelligence. This development follows Musk's recent endorsement of Trump and their evolving political alliance.
summary: Former President Donald Trump expressed interest in having Elon Musk help streamline government operations if he wins the upcoming election. Trump praised Musk's brilliance and suggested he could serve as a high-level consultant focusing on artificial intelligence. This development follows Musk's recent endorsement of Trump and their evolving political alliance.

title: US elections: Was DNC a superspreader event of Covid? Netizens react as multiple attendees test positive
content: Following the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, numerous attendees, including reporters and audience members, tested positive for Covid-19. The four-day event saw significant participation, including Vice President Kamala Harris. Several attendees shared their positive results on social media, describing their disappointment. This gathering marked the first major in-person Democratic event since 2016.
summary: Following the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, numerous attendees, including reporters and audience members, tested positive for Covid-19. The four-day event saw significant participation, including Vice President Kamala Harris. Several attendees shared their positive results on social media, describing their disappointment. This gathering marked the first major in-person Democratic event since 2016.

title: China's military says it conducted armed patrols, joint police patrols near China-Myanmar border
content: China's military organized units and joint air-ground police patrols near the Myanmar border to maintain security as clashes between Myanmar's junta and rebel forces worsened. The operations focused on areas like Ruili and Zhenkang. China's increased military presence aimed to stabilize the region after artillery shells from Myanmar caused damage and injuries on Chinese territory.
summary: China's military organized units and joint air-ground police patrols near the Myanmar border to maintain security as clashes between Myanmar's junta and rebel forces worsened. The operations focused on areas like Ruili and Zhenkang. China's increased military presence aimed to stabilize the region after artillery shells from Myanmar caused damage and injuries on Chinese territory.

title: Warren to Vance: ‘Women are not stupid’ as GOP VP pick says Trump ‘would veto’ abortion ban
content: Senator Elizabeth Warren criticized Senator JD Vance’s claim that Donald Trump would veto a federal abortion ban if re-elected. Warren argued that even without a ban, Trump's administration would still impose restrictions. She referenced the historic Comstock Act and urged voters to support pro-abortion rights candidates to ensure the restoration of nationwide access to abortion.
summary: Senator Elizabeth Warren criticized Senator JD Vance’s claim that Donald Trump would veto a federal abortion ban if re-elected. Warren argued that even without a ban, Trump's administration would still impose restrictions. She referenced the historic Comstock Act and urged voters to support pro-abortion rights candidates to ensure the restoration of nationwide access to abortion.

title: Democracy on line? Swing state Wisconsin offers a test
content: Michael Hovde, a Wisconsin voter, viewed Trump as a threat to democracy, highlighting concerns about Trump's associates and Project 2025. Meanwhile, Casey Stern supported Trump, focusing on inflation, immigration, and crime. Wisconsin, a pivotal state, has experienced intense partisanship, with the recent Supreme Court ruling on redistricting potentially impacting the upcoming election.
summary: Michael Hovde, a Wisconsin voter, viewed Trump as a threat to democracy, highlighting concerns about Trump's associates and Project 2025. Meanwhile, Casey Stern supported Trump, focusing on inflation, immigration, and crime. Wisconsin, a pivotal state, has experienced intense partisanship, with the recent Supreme Court ruling on redistricting potentially impacting the upcoming election.

title: US elections: Taylor Swift set to endorse Kamala Harris? ‘Excited about possibility of a woman in the White House’
content: Taylor Swift was expected to endorse Kamala Harris's presidential bid, offering significant support to Harris’s campaign. Swift's influence and fan base, along with her history of mobilizing youth voters, could play a crucial role in the election. Both Biden and Harris sought her endorsement, while Trump’s camp showed uncertainty about Swift’s political alignment.
summary: Taylor Swift was expected to endorse Kamala Harris's presidential bid, offering significant support to Harris’s campaign. Swift's influence and fan base, along with her history of mobilizing youth voters, could play a crucial role in the election. Both Biden and Harris sought her endorsement, while Trump’s camp showed uncertainty about Swift’s political alignment.

title: In likely overture to China, Nepal PM Oli lifts ban on TikTok
Edu ministry adviser calls for stop to forced resignations
'For 20 years, they let this guy go by with a lie': Critics accuse Walz of military 'misrepresentation'
content: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz faced controversy over past claims about his career achievements and military rank. A 2006 letter from the Nebraska Chamber of Commerce refuted his claim of receiving an award. Additionally, Walz's military rank has been questioned, as he retired as a Master Sergeant, not a Command Sergeant Major, as previously stated.
summary: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz faced controversy over past claims about his career achievements and military rank. A 2006 letter from the Nebraska Chamber of Commerce refuted his claim of receiving an award. Additionally, Walz's military rank has been questioned, as he retired as a Master Sergeant, not a Command Sergeant Major, as previously stated.

title: 'Run, Kamala, Run': Mention of Harris' father was a rare homage to a fleeting figure
content: Kamala Harris attributed her father's words of encouragement from her childhood as an inspiration during her acceptance speech at the Democratic National Convention. She emphasized her mother's significant influence on her life. Her father, Donald J. Harris, a prominent economist, turned 86 the day after her speech but was not among the attending family members.
summary: Kamala Harris attributed her father's words of encouragement from her childhood as an inspiration during her acceptance speech at the Democratic National Convention. She emphasized her mother's significant influence on her life. Her father, Donald J. Harris, a prominent economist, turned 86 the day after her speech but was not among the attending family members.
